employees: CREATE TABLE `employees` (  `id` int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,  `name` varchar(14) NOT NULL,  `datetime` varchar(14) NOT NULL,  `department_id` int(11) NOT NULL,  `job_id` int(11) NOT NULL,  PRIMARY KEY (`id`),  FOREIGN KEY (`department_id`) REFERENCES `departments`(`id`),  FOREIGN KEY (`job_id`) REFERENCES `jobs`(`id`))
departments: CREATE TABLE `departments` (  `id` int(11) NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,  `department` varchar(40) NOT NULL,  PRIMARY KEY (`id`), UNIQUE KEY `department` (`department`))
jobs: CREATE TABLE `jobs` (  `id` int(11) NOT NULL,  `job` varchar(50) NOT NULL,  PRIMARY KEY (`id`))
